intro: Astephanus fallax, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. The flowers, which bloom in shades of purple, pink, and white, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
